intro: Conomorpha reticulata, commonly known as the reticulated conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves with a reticulated venation pattern. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
